title: 112_hr5824
content: The "Territorial TANF Equity Act of 2012" eliminates the cap on certain payments to Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa. The Social Security Act is amended to redesignate subsections and make conforming amendments. The Social Security Act is amended to redesignate subsections and make conforming amendments, including changes to subsections (d), (e), and (f) as outlined in the provided text chunk. SEC. 3. SUPPLEMENTAL GRANTS TO PUERTO RICO, THE VIRGIN ISLANDS, GUAM, AND AMERICAN SAMOA. Section 1108(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to provide supplemental grants to territories. Each territory will receive a grant based on a percentage of the family assistance grant or a fixed amount, depending on the territory. The necessary funds for these grants are appropriated annually. ELIGIBILITY OF PUERTO RICO, THE VIRGIN ISLANDS, GUAM, AND AMERICAN SAMOA FOR TANF CONTINGENCY FUND. The eligibility criteria for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa under the TANF Contingency Fund are amended to include alternative eligibility criteria established by the Secretary in consultation with the Governor of the State. The eligibility criteria for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa under the TANF Contingency Fund are amended to include alternative criteria established by the Secretary in consultation with the State Governor. Eligibility criteria for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa for child care entitlement funds are amended. The eligibility criteria for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa for child care entitlement funds are amended to include them as states under the Social Security Act. The amount of payment for these territories is set at 60 percent of the amount required to be paid to the State for fiscal year 2010 under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. The text chunk discusses the total amount required to be paid to states for child care expenditures under the Social Security Act. It also mentions the allotment of the remainder of the total amount to states. The total amount available for payments to states under the Social Security Act is allotted based on specific percentages to Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa, with the remainder distributed among other states using a designated formula. The total amount available for payments to states under the Social Security Act is allotted based on specific percentages to Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa, with the remainder distributed among other states using a designated formula, including payments to each State under section 403(n) of this Act. SEC. 6 of the Social Security Act increases the federal matching rate for foster care and adoption assistance in Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, and American Samoa to 75 percent. SEC. 7 states that these amendments will take effect in the 1st fiscal year that begins 1 year or more after the date of enactment of the Act.
